content.text:
I'm ready to help you explore the codebase and design implementation plans. I understand that I'm in READ-ONLY mode and will not create, modify, or delete any files.

Let me start by understanding the current project structure:

<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /Users/patrick/workingdir/personal-agent && find . -type f -name "*.md" -o -name "README*" | head -20</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /Users/patrick/workingdir/personal-agent && ls -la</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /Users/patrick/workingdir/personal-agent && find . -maxdepth 3 -type d | grep -E "(src|packages)" | head -30</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

I can see this is a personal agent project with:
- A **desktop application** (Tauri-based in `packages/desktop`)
- A **Go backend** (`go-backend/`)
- A **website** component (`website/`)

From the git status, I can see recent work includes:
- Agent runtime/state management improvements
- Skills structure refactoring
- Desktop UI enhancements
- New capabilities: onboarding, feedback, screenshot tools
- Task scheduler implementation

The project appears to be building an AI agent platform with desktop integration, backend services, and a web presence.

I'm ready to receive your requirements and design perspective. What would you like me to help you plan?
